page.title: 04Local History 1 -Yardley
page.content: Blakesley Hall Blakesley Hall was built by Richard Smallbroke,a rich farmer,sometime between 1573 and 1590.He was also a merchant dealing in imported cloths and spices.When Richard died in 1613 the hall passed to his grand-daughter, Barbara,who married,first Henry Deuereux,and later Ailmer Foliot of Pirton court near Pershore.Their son, Ailmer,inherited the estate.His will gives a good description of the interior of the hall and its contents. After the Foliots,the estate was bought in 1684 by Henry Greswolde,Rector of Solihull and let to tenant farmers.In 1899 the Greswolde family sold the house to Henry Donne.Two years later it was bought by Thomas Merry who lived there until 1932 when it was acquired by the Corporation as a branch of the City Museums and Art Gallery.
